intro: Stephania convolvulacea, commonly known as the creeping gourd or Indian snakeroot, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia, including India and China. It belongs to the family Menispermaceae and is characterized by its climbing habit and heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are followed by berries containing toxic seeds. Its roots are often used in traditional medicine, though they contain compounds that can be harmful if not prepared properly. Due to its toxicity, it is important to handle the plant with care.
